sen.j: 菅原 古人（すがわら の ふるひと、生没年不詳）は奈良時代から平安時代にかけての貴族。
sen.e: SUGAWARA no Furuhito (years of birth and death unknown) was a nobleman who lived in Nara and Heian periods.

sen.j: 天応 (日本)元年（781年）、朝廷より「菅原氏」のカバネを名乗る事を許される。
sen.e: In 781, the imperial court granted Furuhito a leave for the use of Kabane (hereditary title used in ancient Japan to denote rank and political standing) of the 'Sugawara' clan.

sen.j: 学問に優れ、遠江国国司、文章博士、大学頭と出世していった。
sen.e: Academically superior, Furuhito's career included: Kokushi (provincial governor) of Totoumi Province, Monjo (or Monzo) Hakase (Professor of Literature), and Daigaku no kami (Director of the Bureau of Education which was called in Japanese Daigakuryo, Otsukasa or Fumiyatsukasa).

sen.j: だが古人は学問以外には無頓着であったため、菅原家は朝廷からの援助を受けていたという。
sen.e: Furuhito was indifferent to anything other than his academic interests, and therefore, the Sugawara family was financially supported by the court, despite his successful career.
